Patients in the SARS‑CoV‑2 cohort exhibited a higher incidence of cytokine storm compared with those infected with influenza virus, prompting the use of targeted IL‑6 blockade to mitigate respiratory failure.
Patients with severe SARS‑CoV‑2 infection often develop a cytokine storm that damages the pulmonary alveolar epithelium and triggers acute respiratory distress syndrome.
Vaccination against SARS‑CoV‑2 has been shown to reduce the incidence of severe respiratory failure in elderly patients with comorbid cardiovascular disease.
Vaccinated individuals exposed to SARS‑CoV‑2 exhibited a markedly lower incidence of severe pneumonia compared with unvaccinated controls.
Vaccinia virus infection of the epidermis triggers a robust interferon‑mediated antiviral response that recruits plasmacytoid dendritic cells to the skin.
Vaccines targeting the spike protein of SARS‑CoV‑2 have been shown to reduce viral load and prevent severe respiratory failure in high‑risk elderly patients.
